---
title: "COMPUTES"
---

![](/img/survey.png){width="259"}

The *COMputational Practices in Undergraduate TEaching of Statistics* (COMPUTES) is an instrument designed to measure the extent to which computation practices---specifically data, simulation, and coding practices---are included in the introductory statistics curriculum. The instrument includes 23 items.

<br />

## Citation

Please use the following citation for COMPUTES:

::: hanging-indent
Legacy, C., Zieffler, A., Fry, E. B., & Le, L. (2022). COMPUTES: Development of an instrument to measure introudctory statistics instructors' emphasis on computational practices. *Statistics Education Research Journal*, *21*(1), 7-7 <https://doi.org/10.52041/serj.v21i1.63>
:::
